text: The wail of a siren grows out of the distance and very fa through the fog we see the headlights and flashing blue r lights of a police car coming toward us. It drops into a  dip, reappears almost immediately, hurtling down the cent of the deserted highway. It gets closer and closer until lights and siren fill our senses then zooms past us.
A frightened SECURITY GUARD is tensed forward off the bac seat, his hands clutched into the fabric between the two  regular POLICE OFFICERS in front.
(an edge of fear in  his voice) It's coming up... Slow down... (he points out between  them) There, right there...
Through the windshield we can see the headlights pick up billboard announcing a 'new' housing development.

The squad car skids off the asphalt in front of the sign starts up a rutted dirt road. The sign tells us we are he for 'Pinewood Estates,' a housing development financed by the Farmers Bank of Wisconsin.

The Security Guard is becoming more agitated. He wipes a  cold sweat off his brow. The blue flashers reflect off th fog onto the faces of the men. Suddenly the Security Guar lunges forward and slaps off the rack lights and siren.
(startled) Benny, God, take it easy...
I don't want to scare them away.
The two Police Officers exchange an indulgent look.
Using only its parking lights, the police car creeps up t dirt road between skeletons of unfinished houses.
The windows are rolled down. Periodically one of the men  leans out for a better look at the terrain around them.
Smells smoke...
I told you.
The police car comes around a curve on the hillside and s Above them on the next hill, a necklace of embers from a  grass fire and a burning tree flicker through the fog. Th men get out of the car.
(loud whisper) There!! Up on the hill!!
The officer steps forward for a better look. Benny hangs his shoulder.
Right in line with that burning tree.
I don't see anything.
It's there. The fog's thicker now,  but it's there. What do you think  started those fires?
The officer strains to see through the fog.
Benny, there's nothing there.
There is. They came out of the belly  of the ship and then went to the  first terrace and flew down into the  houses.
Flew?! Oh, come on Benny...
The second officer is peering intently at something down  among the houses.
You hear that, Mike? Now he's telling  us...
What's that?

Benny and the officer look to where Mike is pointing. Wha appears to be the beam of a powerful headlight bobs among the houses below them. Further into the track another bea of light moves slightly from right to left but seems othe stationary.
What did I tell you?
Probably kids.
One of the lights rises over a house and settles on the o side.
(not convinced) Probably...

A light shines directly into our eyes. As it swings away  from us we realize that it was the searchlight on the pol car which is idling along the dirt road with its running  lights off. The fire on the hill gives the fog down here red tint.
The police officers are beginning to feel anxious. Benny' nervous fidgeting in the back seat doesn't help them any.
Don't you think you should call a  backup?
No, we can handle this.

The police car passes a road perpendicular to the one it on. A couple of houses down that road a faint glow spills over the sides of an industrial dumpster. As we watch we  hear an eerie high pitched whistle, a shaft of light slow rises out of the metal box and seems to fly off between t houses.

As a humanoid silhouette passes in front of the picture  window, a shaft of light floats by in the fog outside. Th silhouette continues around to look at the kitchen. It ra a hand to eye level. There is a sharp "SNAP" and a hard-e cone of light shoots out of the darkness to capture the i of the kitchen and pulls back a three-dimensional image o stove, sink, cupboards, electrical fixtures and walls to silhouette.

The police car is parked in the middle of the dirt road.  Benny and the officers are intent on a light that reaches them only in strobes as it moves through the houses in th direction of the fire on the hill. The police searchlight swings onto the house.
(over outside speakers) This is the police. Identify  yourselves.

It is deathly silent. Carrying a shotgun the officer motions Benny and Mike to out on either side of him and, guns drawn, they cut acros the tract to where they last saw the bobbing light. The fog quickly isolates them, heightening their fear. Ea man becomes acutely aware of the loudness of his breathin and the crunch of his footsteps on the ground. They drift and out of visual contact with each other. Benny freezes as he hears a burst of the high pitched whi sweep by on his left. He turns slowly to see, through the ribs of an unfinished house, a shaft of the white light  pointing at a cement mixer.
(to the officers, his  voice cracking) There's one over here...
The brilliant light swings toward him. Benny, his hands  trembling, raises the gun.
Stop!! Police!!
The light fixes on Benny and terrified he shakes off a co shots. The light goes out immediately.
(in Benny's direction) What happened?
I think I shot one.
Jesus, Benny. What are you doing?
We are looking at the back of the humanoid figure. It cro to a high window and looks out. The reddish tinge of the outlines him.
The men strain to see something through the silent fog.
You see anything, Mike?
Before Mike can answer, a strange percussive clicking sou is heard. He pumps a shell in the chamber of his shotgun swallowing his fear moves toward the voices. They stop.
This is the police. Identify  yourselves.

Benny, his flashlight throwing a feeble beam in front of  him, inches around the house looking for what he shot at. gets to where it should be but it's not there. His light  searches the area. There is nothing but a stack of lumber Shaking visibly he shuffles to it and peers around its co Nothing. Benny relaxes and allows himself to breathe agai
(shouts to the officers) You wanna give me some help over  here.
Okay...

Benny continues around the house. He flashes his light in a doorway. There is nothing but framing. When he moves on figure steps out of the darkness to fill the space, then  raises its arms. With a sharp snap cylindrical devices sw off its wrist into its hands. At the corner of the house Benny hears the snap and stops The high pitched whistle starts behind him. He stumbles a to face a brilliant white light flying directly at him. B screams in terror and fires at it. The light swerves and laser streak from one of the hand rockets sears Benny's c and knocks him to the ground in pain. Holding his shoulde he watches the light rise and fall erratically between th houses. The officers watch in awe as the beam wobbles through the air, then crashes to the earth.
Mike, call for back-up. (shouting) Benny, you all right?
I don't think so... (clutching his shoulder)
(waving the beam of  his flashlight, shouts) Benny, this is me. I'm going to take  a look.
Benny's beam flashes back.
Don't leave me. I'm coming.

The two men begin to trot toward the light. It swings wil around and, accompanied by the high-pitched whistle, star to stagger back up the hill. Benny and the officer break  into a run. They are on their way up the hill when the li in front of them crashes to the earth. It rolls over and  lays still, the beam shooting straight up into the air. B and the officer slow their pursuit, terrified of what the might find. Suddenly a high-pitched whistle is bearing do on them from behind. Before they can turn a light rockets over their heads. With a rumble the hill begins to vibrat As they follow its flight, they see lights beginning to r to life across the skin of a saucer-shaped spacecraft res at the edge of the forest on top of the hill. With a rumb the hill begins to vibrate. Frightened, the officers stop

The humanoid figure walks rapidly down the hall into the  kitchen. An indistinct image plays on the inside of its  faceplate and we hear the faint sounds of a percussive  language. Through the window over the sink we can see the lights of the spaceship. The rockets flip into the humanoid's gloved hands and it airborne out the open back door.

From the road Benny and the officer watch as the humanoid figure that just blasted over them flies between the tree and into the white light emitting from the underbelly of spacecraft. The noise from the ship's power plant is deaf as it begins to rise above the trees. With Mike at the wheel the police car, its rack lights  flashing, fishtails up the dirt road and slides sideways a bone-jarring stop next to Benny and the officer. As the jump out of the way they find themselves facing into the  super white beam of the figure that was in the house. The are between it and the ship. At the angle that it is comi up the hill, the light looks like it is heading directly them. This is too much for the officer and in terror he r his shotgun and fires wildly at it. The figure veers off disappears into the fog. With an awesome roar the spacecraft reaches escape veloci and hurtles into the night sky. The concussion waves knoc Benny and the officers off their feet.
The escaped figure's light comes out of the fog at tree  height. We hear the high-pitched whistle of its rockets. burst of percussive language comes from behind the facepl
Lander four to Mapmaker Wind. Fix  position for rescue. Repeat. Fix  position for rescue.

The fires on the hillside have been renewed. Shaking, Ben and the officer rise to their feet and start toward the l shafting straight up from the figure lying on the hillsid The only sound is police chatter coming out of the radio the open squad car.
An 18-wheeler with a load of logs lumbers past us.

It feels cozy with the wipers slapping the rain off the  windshield. The DRIVER is trying to steal a cigarette out his snoring PARTNER'S pocket without waking him up. He ge one and reaches for the lighter.
The escaped figure banks around a blind corner.

The driver gets a glimpse of something in his headlights slams on the brakes, but it is too late. The figure hits spoiler above the cab. We hear the smack of impact. One o its boots scars the windshield.

The figure bounces off the jack-knifing truck and like a  wounded bird tumbles through the air into the trees. With the light spinning crazily, it plunges through the boughs and smashes face first into the mud at the bottom of an  embankment. The strip lights on the sides of its helmet g out.
The driver and his partner, standing in the shafts of the high beams, are peering into the woods.
What the hell was it anyway?
Damned if I know.

The figure thrashes over on its back and tries to close a shoulder-to-hip tear in its life-support suit. By the fai identification light that flickers on and off inside its  helmet, we see a MAN FROM THE STARS. His skin is transluc coral. He is gasping as our atmosphere mixes with his and threatens to suffocate him. Under his translucent skin a maze of veins and arteries e from a white mass that sits in the upper half of his head He is hairless. Underneath a graceful fore-head, transpar eyelids droop over black pupilless eyes. The thin lips th delineate his mouth are chalk-white. He tries to clutch the edges of the tear together but is weak. His hands drop limply from the suit, allowing the r to gape open and reveal the translucent body underneath.
Come on. I'm getting wet.
It musta been a bird.
How about if I drive now?

Behind the faceplate a piece of white light breaks off fr the shining mass in the STAR MAN'S head and moves down hi neck. Through the hole in the suit we see it arrive at th top of his single lung. The white light spreads throughou the organ like a phosphorescent tide. The STAR MAN lapses into unconsciousness as we hear the truck pull away.

A light rain is falling. We are looking through the windscreen at the gray landsca passing under the helicopter. MARC SHERMIN, a grizzled ma in his mid-fifties with an honest stubborn face, shifts h attention from the right side to the left side of the cra Below him he can see the road leading into the housing tr is blocked by police cars. The helicopter leans into a ba turn and the spacecraft's blackened landing site comes in view. Below it an orange nylon tent has been erected over the dead extraterrestrial. It glows from the inside. An A Force helicopter is parked on the other side of the burn.

A man in a white contamination suit is helping Benny and two officers into the Air Force helicopter. The three men are glassy-eyed and wrapped in blankets. Benny has a band across his chest. They look up at Shermin's descending  helicopter. They are still looking at it when they disapp inside. Shermin's unmarked S65 settles on the clearing. The nose  door is open and Shermin, carrying the hood of his  contamination suit, comes down the ladder. A tall homespu man, also in a hoodless contamination suit, steps forward greet him.
(around a cigarette) Major Aaron Bell...
Marc Shermin, National Security  Agency.
Shermin takes a moment to look over at the tent, the gree hillside and the forest beyond. It is pastoral in the sof light of dawn.
This has always been my favorite  time of day.
Very beautiful country up here...
Any signs of biological contamination,  excessive radiation, anything like  that?
Not on the landscape. We're trying  to get a tube under the faceplate  for a reading on possible deadly  lifeforms but it's hard going.
Can you see under the faceplate?
No.
Bell's hands shake as he lights a new cigarette off the o in his mouth.
There's a good chance you could be  wrong about this thing then...
Wait'll you see it.
He throws away the cigarette and begins to put on his  contamination hood. Shermin follows as they start for the tent.
We had a flight of F16's play tag  with the spaceship over Michigan for  an hour. Then it shot straight up  and disappeared.
Was there visual contact?
No, sir. Radar.
It could have been anything.

Hooded, Bell and Shermin make their way past three suited scientists examining the landscape with geiger counters a other sensing instruments. With the coming of dawn and Be handlight we can clearly see the pod indentations and the huge black glass cup of earth that was fused by the energ blasting out of the spaceship's power plant.
After I called in, I had a chance to  sit down with the three locals. They  swear there's another one that didn't  make the ship... It might be alive.
People have made mistakes in these  situations before.

I've been investigating sightings  for seventeen years, Mr. Shermin.  This one's real. We have a dead extra- terrestrial in that tent and another  one in the area that might be alive.  We've been visited. It's finally  happened and the sooner Washington  accepts that and starts figuring out  how we're going to deal with these  beings, the better off we're going  to be.

It is still raining. The STAR MAN stirs and awakens with a start. He parts the tear in his suit and looks at his lung through his transl body. It has changed in color from brown to a rich yellow ocher. He takes several deep breaths of our atmosphere an his lung expands and contracts easily. He conducts a quic inventory of his damaged spacesuit, then struggles to his knees and stands up.

The sound of a powerful slow-speed drill greets Bell and  Shermin as they enter. The extraterrestrial is still on i back with its helmet lights shining straight up. A hose t extends from a portable gas chromatograph has been suctio sealed to a corner of the faceplate. A SCIENTIST is makin adjustments at the chromatograph while his COMPANION is  monitoring the progress of the drill into the faceplate.  Both are wearing contamination suits. A foam-lined coffin-shaped metal box is on the ground nex to one of the walls. Bell and Shermin approach the body.  Shermin's first look is at the faceplate, but all he can is his own reflection. His eyes travel down the body.
Look at the hands.

The gloved hands of the figure have only three fingers an thumb. Shermin takes Bell's flashlight. He angles it at the  faceplate. As he leans in to follow the beam, the pitch o the drill rises. He shifts the light. The drill breaks th and the faceplate explodes out of the helmet. The men thr themselves back in panic. When they turn back to look,  distorted impressions of the face inside the helmet refle on the glass of their contamination hoods. (Pause)
Oh, Jesus.
(moving toward the  body) We better get it into the box. Come  on...

The other men approach the body but before they can bend it a burst of percussive language, followed by a low buzz comes from inside the extraterrestrial's helmet. The men  freeze. There is another burst of percussive language and projection beam shoots out of the helmet throwing the ima of the escaped STAR MAN onto one of the scientists. He ju aside and the beam falls out of focus and indistinct on t tent wall behind him.
Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?
(incredulous) The other one is alive!
The STAR MAN is standing. We hear the sounds of his percu language coming from behind his mirrored faceplate.
(subtitle) Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?
His answer is nothing but the low buzz. He taps a series buttons on his chest panel and speaks again.
Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?
Again the buzz.
Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

The buzz continues. He is very still for a moment. Then h presses the palms of his hands together, prayer fashion, concentrates. When he pulls them apart, a blue force fiel pulses between them. He stops at shoulder width. A solari aerial view of the United States forms on the force field green dot appears in the area of western Wisconsin, a red dot in the area of Death Valley, California. He drops his hands to his lap and sits very still. The solarized compa remains floating in the air in front of him. After a long moment he reaches up and squeezes it into a ball that  disappears when his palms come together.

Shermin steps through the open bay door into a communicat room. The radar and radio consoles each have a TECHNICIAN third technician, LYMAN, sits in front of a square of six medium-sized television screens.
Is it for real?
Get Fox.

Lyman taps a code into the computer keyboard. There's a s of static on one of the TV screens. When it clears up GEO FOX, mid-forties, hair slicked straight back, round wire- rimmed glasses, is peering intently into the camera.
(before Fox can speak) It's real, George.
There's no mistake? You're absolutely  sure?
I saw it with my own eyes. We've  killed an extraterrestrial and...
Is there any possibility that it's a  hoax? Could you be mistaken?
None. And there's another one in the  area that's alive. I don't know if  it's the only one. I don't know if  it was left here by accident or it's  part of an inva...
Get the body out of there. Load it  on the Air Force chopper and get it  to Wright Patterson. They'll take it  from there... We didn't expect this,  Shermin.
(answering the  accusation) Neither did I.
Major Bell enters the helicopter.
We're going... Damn! (he shakes his head  in disbelief) We'll tell the press that there was  an accident. Chemical warfare spill.  That cover cannot be violated in any  way. Understand me, Shermin?
Major Bell here, sir. We have to  tell these people that we're friendly.  That this whole thing was a mistake.  Is anyone trying to contact the ship?
(ignores this) Shermin, I want you and Bell to start  looking for the one on the ground.
We'll need a lot of help, George.  You could hide an army up here.
I'm going to the White House right  now. I'll try and get you everything  you need.
Wait, wait... What are my orders if  we find this thing?
Fox sits silently for a second.
Contain it and get back to me.
What do you mean by 'contain?'
Fox knows Shermin is looking for a definite order.
Just what I said.
The television screen is reduced to static. Shermin stare at it blankly then Lyman turns it off.
The lift off of Shermin's helicopter reveals contaminatio suited scientists slipping the dead extraterrestrial's co into the Air Force helicopter.

The STAR MAN, still in his life-support suit, looks surre in the twilight world under the canopy of firs. The morni rain has gone. A hum of traffic pulls him across the hill a stand of alders that border the forest. Through the lea he can see a highway entering the sprawl of Eau Claire,  Wisconsin. The cars and trucks zipping along the asphalt of particular interest to him. When he has absorbed them he walks through the trees to g a better look at the town. On the wind he can hear shouts from students boarding a line of yellow buses in front of grade school off to his right. Suburban houses have begun snuggle up to the base of the hill he is on. Keeping to the tree line well above them he continues his search for an avenue of escape. His head swivels to watch Volvo station wagon come down the street. It swings into driveway of the house directly below him and stops next t Mustang Hatchback. The back door opens and JENNY HAYDN, a pretty girl in her mid-twenties, gets out carrying a crud lettered be-ribboned sign 'Welcome Back, Mrs. Haydn.' Fem voices drift up to the STAR MAN from inside the car.
It was great to have you back... The  kids loved it. We loved it. You're  doing the right thing...
I hope so... We'll see... See you  tomorrow... Bye. Bye.
(as the Volvo backs  out of the driveway) Remember you're required to have a  lesson planned tomorrow.
Jenny laughs and waves. With the Volvo moving away up the street Jenny picks her newspaper off her walk and goes in the house.

The STAR MAN presses on through the trees. He hears a lig plane overhead. He stops and watches until the branches c off his view. A path between two logs leads him to the ti of a promontory. From behind the cedars growing there, he sits and looks down on the center of Eau Claire. Arm in arm, a YOUNG COUPLE meander through the trees. The boy has a blanket over his shoulder and the girl's hair i disheveled. Without seeing him, they walk past the STAR M crouched in a thicket of small pines. After they've gone he straightens up and watches them walk down toward the  highway.

The sun is setting over suburban Eau Claire. The colors a reflected in the STAR MAN's faceplate as he watches Jenny push a hand mower over her back yard. He takes a dusty gray marble out of a leg pocket and whil Jenny finishes the lawn he rolls it between his gloves. I turns a glowing gold as it grows in size. When it reaches the dimensions of a baseball, he brings it close to his  faceplate and speaks into it.

(subtitles) Iron channel message. Suit and rockets  destroyed. Radical mixture of this  atmosphere and ours in helmet allowed  chemo-ion response time to adapt my  body to this air. Am going to attempt  extreme transformation in order to  cross land mass to site of our  practice landings. If transformation  is not fatal, second message ball by  next darkness.

He opens his hands and the ball rises quickly into the sk Jenny is dumping the grass clippings into a garbage can a the side of the house when the sudden motion of the messa ball catches her eye and she watches it quizzically until disappears.
We are on the belly of Shermin's helicopter looking at th tree tops rushing underneath.

Shermin is standing back of Lyman and Bell who are seated front of the square of television screens watching variou shots of the wooded landscape flowing by under them. Sher scrubs his hands over his face then bends over to stretch his back.
Aghh... I'm supposed to umpire a  little league game tomorrow.
I wouldn't worry about it... There  might not be any little league  tomorrow.
Pause.
I'm telling you they're probably  friendly.
Then why did they try and sneak in  the back door? Tell me that. Why  didn't they contact us first and  say...
(loud) UFO coming out of the grass.
Lock in.
Got it.

Lyman and the technicians tap out orders to their trackin units and the views of the forest on three of the televis screens change to images from their microwave scanners,  neutron back scatters and doppler radar. On a fourth scre the forward-looking infrared module begins creating a pic of the UFO. The men relax as they recognize the configura of a light sea plane.
This is crazy. What were we going to  do if that had been the ship? We  have two thirty calibre machine guns,  three M16's and some handguns.
Give it a rest, Lyman.
(after a pause) I've never once heard of anybody  being hurt by an extraterrestrial...
Shermin goes hand over hand along the overhead straps to radio operator. He begins to flip through a stack of tele messages.
That's because the ones that were  hurt, died. They couldn't talk to  you.
(to technician, after  a look at Lyman) Any reports about monsters, people  in Halloween masks, anything like  that?
No, but there sure were a lot of  people who saw lights in the sky  last night. Reports are still coming  in.
(under above) I've heard of blood being drawn,  sometimes they were taken for a ride  in the ship, a lot of times they  said they had sex... But nobody was  ever hurt...
But you decided those weren't real.  This one is.
There is a buzz and a red dot appears in the center of on of the screens.
(over his shoulder to  Shermin) Fox.
He taps a three digit code and Fox comes into view.
I've got something for you.

A photograph of a very thin slab of yellow plastic pops u on a second screen next to Fox. Above lines of glowing co dots are symbols of a hydrogen atom, pulsars, a nude man a woman and Earth's position in our solar system.
Recognize this?
It's a copy of the plaque NASA sent  into space on the Pioneer probes.
Houston found it in the  extraterrestrial's suit.
They must have picked it up in space.
Then it's not an accident that they  found us.
We don't think that's necessarily  bad. At least it's a point of contact.
Not necessarily bad! If they knew we  were here why didn't they let us  know they were coming?
We'll get those answers when you  find the one you're looking for.
That's not going to happen, George,  unless you get us the help you  promised us.
We've been back and forth on this  all day and keeping in mind the panic  that would occur if this got to the  general public, it's been decided  not to expand the search at this  time.
Don't let them do it this way, George.  It's too important. We can't find  this thing alone.
You have to. We're trying to contact  the ship. If we do, I'll let you  know immediately. Good luck.
The television screen is reduced to static. Lyman shuts i off.
You get the feeling we're expendable?
We always were.

We are looking through the living room window at Jenny  watching television while she irons the clothes she plans wear to work tomorrow. The STAR MAN stands just outside t light-fall in the back yard watching her. A commercial interrupts the old movie with a jolly fat MA in a jumpsuit touting his used cars. The two words 'We  have...' are repeated constantly during the pitch. 'We ha automatics... We have sticks... We have colors... We have financing...' ... We move in close on the STAR MAN'S faceplate.
(practicing the human  sound) Wehave... (more precise) Wehave... (well-formed) Wehave...
Jenny finishes the skirt, unplugs the iron, picks up the  clothes, shuts off the television, the light and heads  upstairs. Half way up she stops.
(faint through the  glass) Damn!

She turns around and looks down indecisively, then hurrie upstairs. A light goes on in the bedroom. The STAR MAN ba away to look up at it. He can't see anything. He is on hi way to try and get in the side door when Jenny comes clum down the stairs in an old sweatshirt and pulling on a pai of jeans. She disappears into the kitchen. Without warnin the door ahead of him is swung open and Jenny rushes out. The STAR MAN barely has time to step into the shadows. Je grabs the handle of one of the garbage cans lined against the house and drags it down to the street. When she comes back for the second one we see that the STAR MAN is no lo in the shadows.
Jenny comes in and locks the door. She passes through the kitchen and is on her way to the stairs when the STAR MAN steps out of the darkness in the living room. A scream ca in Jenny's throat.
(precise) Wehave...

Jenny bolts for the front door. At the end of the hallway her foot catches in a phone cord pulling the phone off an end table. The receiver is jarred out of its cradle. Jenn regains her balance and gets to the door ahead of the STA MAN. She jerks it open, but the guard chain stops it thre inches from the jamb. Frantically, she tries again but th chain holds. The STAR MAN slams the door shut and reaches out to grab  her. She flails back at him. One of her hands strikes the panel on his chest and the identification light comes on  inside his helmet. At the sight of the STAR MAN, Jenny be to scream. He presses her back against the wall and puts mittened hand over her mouth.
Wehave...
Jenny ceases her struggle and begins to cry. The STAR MAN takes his hand away from her mouth.
Please don't hurt me... please...  please.

Holding her with his eyes he grasps one of Jenny's hands lifts it up to look at it. He raises a piece of skin off her wrist, rolls it between his thumb and forefinger. Jenny lets out a blood-curdling scream and strikes out at him. Flashes of light erupt off his exposed chest where s hits. The ferocity of her attack knocks him aside and she sprints up the stairs. The STAR MAN recovers and starts after her.

Jenny gets there two steps ahead of the STAR MAN. She sla the door in his face and locks it. With him POUNDING ON T OUTSIDE, Jenny throws open the closet and begins rummagin madly through the side pockets of her jackets and coats. The POUNDING STOPS. It takes her a moment to hear the sil When she does, she whirls toward the door expecting the w but it remains closed. She waits. All she can hear is the sound of the rain. She intensifies her search.
(hysteria creeping  into her voice) It's got to be here... it's got to  be here...

She finds it in the pocket of a down jacket. The Army iss .45 looks big in her hand. She releases the safety and, w a wary eye on the door, reaches for the phone on the nigh table next to the bed. Long before the receiver gets to her ear, she can hear th "BLEET" caused by the PHONE BEING OFF THE HOOK for so lon in the living room. She hangs up and walks around the bed sit on the corner facing the door. In the distance, we ca HEAR the THUMP OF AN APPROACHING HELICOPTER. After a mome indecision, Jenny gets up and releases the lock. Again sh waits. Nothing happens. With the gun ready, she turns the knob a opens the door a crack. The hallway is empty. She kicks o her shoes and lets herself out of the bedroom.
Jenny creeps toward the stairs in her stockinged feet. Sh looks in the bathroom. The STAR MAN isn't there. She deci to go downstairs.

The STAR MAN isn't in the living room. Jenny sidles along the wall for the front door. At the archway to the den a  hissing sound stops her. She peers around the molding. Th spill from the stairwell light provides the only illumina The STAR MAN is sitting on the edge of a chair with his b to her. He is naked. A dot of light is HISSING around his head. The shadows in the room make it difficult for Jenny tell exactly what is going on. Pointing the .45 at the STAR MAN, she steps into the room for a better look. The floor creaks and the STAR MAN turn to her. Jenny shudders at what she sees. The STAR MAN is  holding an 8x10 color photograph of Jenny and a man in hi mid-twenties standing on a beach in their bathing suits. The dot of light is copying the man's features onto the S MAN'S translucent head. The top two-thirds of the face is already done. Everything is perfect, even the eyes. Jenny begins to tremble and lowers the gun.
(in a small voice) No... please don't...

She sags against the armchair, racked by sobs that are dr out by the FLAP OF THE APPROACHING HELICOPTER. The STAR M with the dot of light stopped on his left cheek, gets up takes the gun from her. He drops it on the couch and raises his eyes to the sound the helicopter NOW DIRECTLY OVER THE HOUSE. THROUGH THE  WINDOWS, we can SEE the searchlight scouring the hillside next to the back yard. The STAR MAN returns to the picture and resumes his  transformation. He completes the chin, then continues dow weaving skin and filling in the human characteristics ove the entire body.
We come down an electrical cord that ends in a micro-phon then down further to DR. BERGEN, a tall thin balding man his late fifties dressed in the medical equivalent of a  contamination suit.
The creature was hit three times...
Using a laser light indicator Dr. Bergen shows us where.

...the arm, the abdomen and the upper  chest, the one in the chest being  the cause of death. It shattered,  for want of a better term, the  creature's backbone. It's not really,  because it's not jointed. It's simply  a hollow shaft of very pliable  silicate material, as is its entire  endoskeleton. The creature seems to  have tremendous regenerative powers.  Although it must have died within  minutes of receiving the fatal wound,  the arm and abdomen wounds are almost  totally healed and the bullet here... (indicates with the  light) has begun to dissolve...

Fox, another CIVILIAN and two MEN in uniform are watching the autopsy on a bank of screens which show Dr. Bergen, t room and various close-ups of the dead extraterrestrial l on a white glass table lit from underneath.

It has veins but no blood. We think,  and this is just speculation, that  some form of energy flows from the  brain, which is much more  sophisticated than ours, throughout  the rest of the body... We don't  think there is any danger of bacterial  contamination. Our biochemistries  are too different...
Shermin and his crew are glued to the monitors, watching autopsy from Houston.

The flesh is gelatinous, the skin is  very porous and very moist. This is  another guess, but it probably comes  from a planet that receives only  reflected light, perhaps from a ring  of moons. Its atmospheric pressure  is slightly less than ours and it  contains a great deal more water...
Dr. Bergen, George Fox here in  Washington. Can you give us an idea  of why they're here?
They're so advanced... I... eh...  can't imagine what they would want  from us. I know they could be  dangerous. But they could also be  the greatest thing that ever happened  to mankind...
Shermin and his crew share mixed reactions.

Jenny, sitting on the floor with her arms wrapped around knees, is reflected in a mirror fastened to the back of t closet door. The STAR MAN edges around the door to look a himself in the glass. In baggy tan cords, a windbreaker a a plaid shirt, buttoned all the way to the neck and a but in the wrong hole halfway down the front, he looks like a innocent abroad. He notices the shirt is askew across his chest and, with his new hands, awkwardly resets the butto He looks himself over. His movements resemble a human's b are noticeably more precise. The clothes seem right so he leans into the mirror to ins his face. He squeezes the skin on his cheeks, examines hi eyes, turns his head as far as he can to inspect the side of his face, folds his ears forward to check the skin beh them and he even gives a good two-fisted tug to his hair see if it is on securely. He turns from the mirror and goes over to where the .45 a a leg pouch from his life-support suit are lying on the b next to a snapshot of the man whose identity he has taken In the picture the man is dressed exactly as the STAR MAN now. The STAR MAN picks up the gun and the pouch and, spe to Jenny in his own language, steps to the door and motio for her to follow. Jenny consciously ignores him. The STA MAN comes over, reaches down and grabs her arm to pull he to her feet. Jenny squirms back, but he holds her tight. looks at the hand, almost touches it, then up at the fami yet disturbingly unfamiliar face above her.
Please...
Don't... don't do this... please...
The STAR MAN gets her to her feet and hustles her out of room. On the dresser is Jenny's wedding picture. The man STAR MAN has become is her husband.
The STAR MAN pulls Jenny down the stairs.
(struggles to free  herself) You're hurting me. Stop.
The STAR MAN guides her into the entryway and reaches for the front door. Realizing his intentions, Jenny increases her struggle and manages to pull away.
Oh, God, no! I'm not leaving this  house with you. You're going to hurt  me, I know...
The STAR MAN looks intently at her, then opens the front  door. He taps his chest, points to Jenny and motions to t dawn outside.
(through tears) I can't. I'd like to help. You look  like Scott, but I know you're not. I  don't know what you are. You gotta  understand, I'm afraid of you...
As Jenny backs into the living room, the STAR MAN closes door. He raises the gun, examines it quickly, then with h finger around the trigger, points it at Jenny.
Please.
Why are you doing this to me? I'll  give you whatever...
The STAR MAN swings the muzzle sights across Jenny's body and FIRES. A FLOOR VASE EXPLODES. Jenny turns to look at remains, then back to the STAR MAN.
The Mustang is backing out of the driveway with Jenny beh the wheel and the STAR MAN perched nervously on the passe seat.

Wary of what will happen next, the STAR MAN watches Jenny move the gear selector to the drive position. The car jerks forward and he grabs the dashboard to keep  from toppling back in the seat. During the ride up the block, his head swivels from side side trying to take in as much of the darkened urban land as he can. When the car stops at a 'stop' sign, he looks Jenny questioningly.
Please...
Which way do you want to go?
She motions ahead and he turns to look at an inter-sectio with streets running in three directions off of it. His e question Jenny again.
You can go that way... (points left) That way... (straight ahead) That way...

She points right. After another look at Jenny, the STAR M presses the palms of his hands together, concentrates bri then slowly draws them apart. The force field appears bet them. On it the solarized view of the United States rotat until the red destination dot is on his right. He drops h hands and points to the right.
(measured) That way.
The satel compass continues to hover over the dashboard.
(staring incredulously  at the compass) God, what are you?

She starts her right turn without looking left and fails see a little MG approaching from that direction. The WAIL THE AIR HORN startles Jenny and reflexively she slams on brakes. The Mustang stalls and the MG squeals around them. Jenny  checks the STAR MAN. He has pressed himself against the  passenger door. The gun lies on the seat next to him. The both look at it. The STAR MAN recovers and picks it up.
(starting the engine) I'm sorry...

This time when Jenny puts the car into drive, the STAR MA is ready for the acceleration. The car completes the turn and the compass rotates to its new heading. Looking at it from this angle, Jenny suddenly recognizes it for what it is: an aerial view of the United States.
That green dot, that's us, isn't  it... and the red's where you want  to go?... You don't understand me,  do you?
The STAR MAN looks at her uncomprehendingly.
(to herself) I gotta get out of here.
The Mustang cruises through the industrial section of Eau Claire.

The STAR MAN is watching Jenny drive. A set of headlights rushes TOWARD US in the other lane. Jenny twists around t follow the car as it goes by and we SEE the desperation o her face. When she returns her attention to the road, she sneaks a  glance at the STAR MAN to see if her action has given awa her state of mind. His expression hasn't changed. Jenny t a deep breath and lets it out slowly. Uttering a phrase i his own language, the STAR MAN touches the steering wheel
(startled) What?
(thinking the steering  wheel is called  'what," he repeats) What.
With the same phrase in his language, he points to the 'g shift.'
(realizing her mistake) Ah... no...
(repeats) Ah no.
He points to the dashboard. Jenny senses there is going t be a great deal of misunderstanding if she uses more word She shakes her head 'no' and touches the steering wheel.
(enunciates) Steering wheel...
(correcting her) What.
Jenny shakes her head 'no.'
Steering wheel.
(repeats) Steering wheel.
(points to the gear  shift) Gear shift.
Gear shift.
(slaps the dashboard) Dashboard.
Dashboard.
Jenny sees a police car creeping across the intersection  ahead of her and interrupts the lesson to stare at it. Th STAR MAN looks to where she is looking.
(alarmed) What?!
Eh... police.
(remembering) Police...
He raises the gun off his lap. Jenny tries to distract hi
(raps on the steering  wheel) What?...
With his eyes on the police car the STAR MAN ignores her.
Steering wheel... (she points to the  gear shift) What?
The STAR MAN is intent on the police car. Jenny gives up  trying to distract him. The patrol car passes out of thei view. The STAR MAN lowers the gun and looks at Jenny.
(unprompted, points  correctly at each  item) Steering wheel... gear shift...  dashboard...
(this frightens Jenny  even more) Good.
Good.
We COME DOWN FROM a red light TO FIND the Mustang stopped behind the limit line.
Which way?
That way.
The light changes and the car proceeds straight across th intersection.
Good.

While the STAR MAN picks through the contents of the glov compartment, Jenny looks for a way to escape. An all-nigh laundromat is a possibility, but it's deserted. The STAR finds the switch on a flash-light and flicks it on and of
What?
(distant) Flashlight.
He puts the flashlight in his lap along with the owner's  manual and gas slips and takes a stack of Discount Coupon out of the glove compartment.
What?
Coupons.

Jenny sees a set of headlights turn into the oncoming lan She slides her eyes toward the STAR MAN. He is busy looki through the Coupons. Jenny measures the distance between Mustang and the oncoming lights. The STAR MAN holds up on of the Coupons and points to a picture of the product.
What?
(curt) Pancakes.
Pancakes.
He points to the cluster of letters that spells SAVE 35.
What?
Jenny doesn't answer. The distance between the two vehicl is narrowing rapidly.
What?
Jenny sets her jaw and wrenches the steering wheel violen to the left.
The Mustang skids sideways across the center line. The  oncoming van jams on its brakes and swerves to its left.  Locked in a skid, it drifts toward the Mustang.

The STAR MAN sucks himself back in terror as the van desc on him. It swings past his window and clips the rear fend of the Mustang. Both vehicles shudder to a stop. Jenny cl at her door. It swings open. She is halfway out before th STAR MAN manages to grab the tail of her sweatshirt. Jenn begins to scream at the top of her lungs and keeps it up  while he tries to wrestle her down on the seat.
A tall, raw-boned MAN in his late twenties storms around front of his van.
You stupid son of a bitch!!
He kicks the Mustang.
(screaming) Help me!!
You could have killed us both!!
(battling to maintain  her grip on the door  frame) He's kidnapping me!!!
The Man bends down to look at the struggle.
Jesus Christ!! You crazy people...
Call the police!!
(not sure he wants to  get involved) Hey buddy... let her go...
The STAR MAN increases his efforts and Jenny loses her gr on one of the door frames.
Help me!!!
(grabbing her other  arm) Hey, she doesn't want to go with  you. Come on.

The STAR MAN frees his right hand and blindly searches th floor for the gun. He comes up with it and, shoving the b in the Man's face, barks a harsh command in his language. The Man freezes and Jenny stops struggling. It's suddenly very quiet on the street.
Oh God, man... don't shoot me... My  mistake... I'm sorry...
He doesn't understand... just walk  away...
The STAR MAN claps a hand over her mouth.

I promise I'm not going to tell  anybody about this... None of my  business... I'm going to move now,  okay... (takes a step to one  side) You guys want to fight, that's up to  you... (takes another step) I'm leaving now... I won't say a  word...

He keeps his eyes on the STAR MAN until he reaches the ba of the Mustang, steals a quick look at the license plate, then blots for his van. The STAR MAN takes his hand off  Jenny's mouth and slams her back into her seat. Uttering expletive in his language he points the gun in her face a keeping it there indicates the red dot on the satel compa floating undisturbed above the dashboard.
Go.
The Mustang moves back into the correct lane and continue on.
Could you put the gun down?
The STAR MAN just stares at her. She points to the gun.
Gun... Down... Down.
Slowly, he lowers it to his lap.
Thank you.
Shermin's helicopter is taking on fuel from an Army tanke truck. The pilot and co-pilot are catching forty winks on the grass next to the old bunkhouse.

Major Bell, bleary-eyed and unshaven, is huddled in front the television screens eating a breakfast off a styrofoam plate. On the top left screen is a satellite picture of  Northern Michigan and half of Wisconsin taken with a Dopp radar. On the lower left screen is an infrared view of the same  area. Over both these views is a schematic of the state  boundaries and major cities. On the screens to the right these views are blow-ups of smaller sections of the overv Lyman and the radar technician are asleep on the floor. S in front of the radio console Shermin is going through th telex messages. Next to him the radio technician is bent  over the desk with his head in his forearms.
There's nothing... No reports of  sightings or landings or anything...  in the other parts of the country or  overseas... Seems like a totally  isolated incident.
It was only an accident that we  discovered them.
I know, but...
Shermin continues on through the messages. Bell asks the  computer to change the pictures on the screens. Rhythmica a sequence of images appears and disappears.
You married, Major?
Twenty-eight years.
To the same woman?
(smiling) Yes.
I tried it once... Fourteen years  ago... 'I was a lousy husband and a  worse father. The only thing I'm  good at is this... At least until  yesterday.
Bell stuffs his breakfast plate into a garbage bag and go to get a breath of fresh air in the open doorway. Shermin stops at a point on the telex sheet. He reads the message himself again.
How would you describe the sounds we  heard coming out of that thing's  helmet?
(after trying to  imitate them) It was kind of like clicking, maybe  a language wasn't it?

Listen to this. (paraphrasing the  telex) A woman was kidnapped in Eau Claire  this morning. When a citizen went to  her rescue the kidnapper threatened  him with a gun and shouted at him in  a strange 'clicking gibberish'...
It was a man though... right?
The police think he was high on  drugs...
Bell shrugs.
What do you think?
With a rush the helicopter rises out of the trees and thu away.
There are Eau Claire police cars on the street. Shermin i out back watching Bell pick his way down the hill. Throug the windows we see uniformed policemen in the living room
(slides the last few  feet down the hill) Nothing up there... The grass is  matted down in a few places, but  that could have been anything.
It was the husband. The police finally  got a hold of the witness at work  and showed him a picture of the woman.
The man standing next to her in the picture was her husba and the witness said that was the guy who kidnapped her.
It's the right area, that's for sure.

Throughout the above, Shermin has noticed a WOMAN in the  house next door peeping through her blinds at the activit around Jenny's. She closes the drapes suddenly when she  realizes Shermin has spotted her.
Why the clicking language though?

Shermin knocks and waits on the steps with Bell for someo to answer. We hear a chain being pulled off and the door opened by a freckled-face MAN in his late thirties, dress in a business suit and wiping the traces of a breakfast f around his mouth.
Sorry to disturb you, sir, but there's  been some trouble next door. I'd  like to ask you a few questions.
What happened?
There's a possibility that Mrs.  Haydn's been kidnapped. We're hoping  you might have seen something.
A WOMAN in a robe opens the door a little wider to includ herself in the conversation. She is as freckled as the ma and about the same age.
(to the Man) I told you...
Judy, that's stupid.

Well, maybe these men won't think  so. We were asleep when a helicopter  woke me up. It made me so nervous I  went into the kitchen for something  to eat. I happened to look out the  window and there was Scott Haydn  with this green thing draped over  his arm pulling Jenny down the walk  to the car.
You know that's impossible!
I know what I saw. I've seen him  enough times.
(giving up on his  wife and addressing  Shermin and Lyman) Scott Haydn is dead. He died about  three months ago. We went to the  funeral.
Shermin and Bell exchange a glance.
Jenny's Mustang is sailing through the beautiful Wisconsi farmland.
R-r-S-s...
The STAR MAN is copying the letters, upper and lower case from the Owner's Manual he found in the glove compartment onto the back of an envelope.
He draws the upper case but has to check the manual for t lower case.
The STAR MAN looks up as they go by a farm.
(pointing correctly  to the various animals) Cow... Dog... Pig...
He looks to Jenny for confirmation. She nods absently. He returns to the alphabet.
He forms both the upper and lower case 'X-x' and shows th to Jenny.
What?
(knows what's coming) X...
Without smiling the STAR MAN opens his mouth and emits a  short chirping laugh.
What's so funny about X?
The STAR MAN laughs harder. Jenny watches him warily. He  starts to hiccup. He is unable to control it through the  laughter.

Shermin's image waits on the television screen. He is gau tired and visibly shaken. The picture sizzles and breaks intermittently. Fox and the three men who watched the aut stride quickly into the room.
(his voice quavering) George, we've just confirmed the  existence of the live  extraterrestrial.
(after a beat) When can we expect containment?
Well, we're in pursuit of a green  Mustang...
(very controlled) It's in a green Mustang?
Yes. It's kidnapped a woman at  gunpoint and from what we can make  out is forcing her to drive it  somewhere.
(to the room) This one has a weapon.
No, no... A .45, it probably got it  in the woman's house. They were last  seen in downtown Eau Claire...
Why did you let it get into a  populated area?
It's taken on a disguise.
Clarify that.
It's made itself look like the woman's  dead husband.
Static breaks up the t.v. picture. When it returns, Fox l toward the screen.
Repeat the last item.
Almost reluctantly Shermin holds up Scott Haydn's picture
The extraterrestrial now looks like  this.
(softly) Oh shit!!!
Jenny's Mustang moves along through the traffic.
We are CLOSE ON the back of a ten-dollar bill.
(reading slowly) The United States of America. In God  We Trust. Ten dollars.
We pull back as he holds the ten up to Jenny.
Money.
Money.
He holds up a quarter.
Money.
Confused, the STAR MAN puts the money back into Jenny's w and reads the first card through its plastic window.
Mi-chi-gan driver li-see-ens...  Jennyhaydn... Money?
(shaking her head  'no,' exhausted) We're going to have to stop for gas  soon.
Under the license is a picture of Jenny smiling broadly. STAR MAN looks at Jenny, back at the picture, then imitat the smile for Jenny.
What?
Smile.
Smile... good?
Yes.
He practices curling the corners of his mouth up into a s One of them freezes as the Interstate curves and a gliste skyline backlit by the afternoon sun comes into view acro a river.
(impressed) What?!
Minneapolis.
(reaching into the  leg pouch he took  from his life-support  suit) Minneapolis... Minneapolis...
What are you doing?
He takes out his camera.
...What's that?
He points the white disc at Minneapolis. With a 'POP,' a  cone of light flashes out. It sucks back, almost instantl bringing with it a three-dimensional image of the skyline
Minneapolis... good.
You're full of tricks, aren't you?
The car starts across the twin cities' bridge.
(taps the fuel gauge) We need gas.
The STAR MAN looks at the gauge. Jenny scrunches against door to avoid contact with him.
No gas.
No gas.
This car runs on gas.
She presses the accelerator to the floor. The car jumps  forward.
Gas...
She takes her foot off the accelerator and the car quickl slows down.
No gas.
Gas.
The Mustang spurts forward a few yards.
No gas.
It staggers down to a crawl.
Gas.
The car leaps forward again.
No gas.
It drops back to a crawl.
No gas... car dead. (her head lolls forward  on her chest) We need gas. I don't want to get  shot for running out of gas.
Gas good?
Yes. Very good.
We are LOOKING DOWN Jenny's arm AT a gas station just off Interstate 169 in the Minneapolis suburbs.
Gas...
The STAR MAN contemplates the station as they pass it, th turns to Jenny, puzzled:
Go.
It's closed... closed. We need one  that's open.
Closed?
You'll see.

There are no more gas stations in sight. The STAR MAN bec bored with the silence. He picks up Jenny's wallet. The  driver's license is familiar so he flips to the next wind In it is a picture of an older man and woman standing in  front of a church.
What?

(snaps) Not what. Who. What is for things. (touching the steering  wheel, dashboard,  seat, gear shift) What? What? What? What? For people  you use who. Who is he? (points to the man in  the picture) Who is she? (points to the woman) Who are you? (points to the STAR
Who am I?
She touches her chest.
(mirrors her gestures) Who is he? Who is she? Who are you?  Who am I? (pause; it clicks for  him and he points at  Jenny) Who are you?
I am Jenny Haydn.
(flips back to her  license and reads) Jennyhaydn.
Jenny nods.
Who are you?
I am...
We HEAR MODULATED CLICKS of his percussive LANGUAGE.
That's a big help. Where are you  from?
From?
(leans forward and  points through the  windshield at the  sky) Are you from up there? Space?
(leans forward to  look with her) Space?
Up there... I... eh... can't  explain... (leans back) But that's the only place you could  be from.
The STAR MAN spots a station on the other side of the  Interstate.
Gas.
(shakes her head 'no') Closed.
He taps the fuel gauge which has dipped below empty.
No gas.
I know.

They both scan the horizon for a gas station. When one do come up immediately, the STAR MAN flips to the next pictu in the wallet. It is of the man he has become. He is lean against a fire truck, in uniform.
Who?
My... husband.
I am husband?
No. I don't know what you are, but  you're not Scott.
Silence. The STAR MAN catches her mood. A tear rolls down Jenny's cheek.
(brushes it away  angrily) Shit.
Shit?
No, no... don't say that. Bad word.
(likes the sound of  it) Shit... shit... what shit?
(screams) Stop!! Enough!! Jesus! You're worse  than a parrot!!
Like closing a zipper, she slides her fingers across her  mouth.
Mouth closed... closed.

The STAR MAN does as he is told. He doesn't like it, but does it. With his lips puckered, he looks straight down t road. The car rises out of a gulley. Topping a knoll stra ahead is a gas station with an enormous Exxon sign revolv above it. With his lips firmly pressed together, he tugs  Jenny's sleeve and points.
I see it.
The STAR MAN reaches forward and squeezes the satel compa back into his palms.
The Mustang comes up the off-ramp toward the pumps.
The STAR MAN'S hand closes around the butt of the .45 whe he sees the ATTENDANT step out of the office.
Who?
Attendant. He'll give us gas. Put  the gun down. Under the seat. Under  the seat...
No.
Oh God! You're going to get us both  killed. Okay... in your pocket...
She shoves her hand into the pocket of her slacks showing him what to do.
In your pocket... pocket...
Jenny eases in next to the pumps and stops. The Attendant already coming around the front of the car.
In your pocket, please...
(draws his fingers  over his lips) You. Mouth closed.
Okay.
The STAR MAN stuffs the gun into the left pocket of his b cords just as the Attendant arrives at the driver's door.
Morning, folks. Fill her up?
The STAR MAN looks at Jenny for help. She sweeps her fing across her mouth to indicate her lips are sealed. The STA MAN peeks around her at the Attendant.
(overly loud) ...Gas...
You got it.
He leaves the window. The STAR MAN watches him until the  nozzle is in the Mustang, then pleased with himself, turn to Jenny and lifts his face into a 'smile.'
I'm going to the ladies' room. You  stay here.

Jenny gets out of the car. When she straightens up, she f the STAR MAN staring at her over the roof. She slams the  door and strides rapidly in the direction of the ladies'  room. Stuffing the green pouch in his pocket, the STAR MA trots after her.
(wheels on him as he  catches up) Go back to the car.
The STAR MAN looks at her but doesn't move. Jenny snarls frustration, then with the STAR MAN on her heels, stalks the ladies' room and throws open the door.
The STAR MAN follows Jenny inside.
See. It's a bathroom. I'm not trying  to escape. I just have to go to the  bathroom.
He checks out the stall.
Satisfied? Now get out. Out.
No.
Furious, Jenny steps around him and opens the door. She p to the sign on it.
Women... me.
She continues out. The STAR MAN goes after her.
Jenny points to the sign on the next door.
Men. You go in here.
She cracks the door for him.
Come on.

He takes the door from her and pushes it open for a look  inside. Jenny ducks into the ladies' room. He is confused for a moment then takes a long look at the men's room. It means nothing to him. He backs out and tries the ladies'  room. It is locked. Not knowing what to do, the STAR MAN  stands uncomfortably in front of the door, then like a ch waiting for his mother, he sits on the curb. He watches t Attendant lift the Mustang's hood and reach in for the  dipstick. The numbers on the pumps turn over, adding up t gallons and the cost of the gas. Everything is peaceful and quiet within the circle of lig cast by the gas station. The STAR MAN pulls the camera di out of his pocket and points it at the pumps. The cone of light flashes out and pulls back its three-dimensional im The Attendant turns around and waves genially at the STAR MAN, who waves back a perfect imitation of the gesture. The SHARP RUMBLE of a SOUPED-UP HONDA MOTORCYCLE coming u the off-ramp shatters the mood and the STAR MAN gets to h feet. He is startled by the image of the RIDER. In a one piece  driving skin and helmet he looks amazingly like a space  traveller. The STAR MAN steps cautiously forward for a be look and mutters something to himself in his language. Th rider stops his bike at the second row of pumps and swing himself stiffly out of the seat.
Do I need a key for the head?
It's open.
Without taking off his helmet, the Rider sets out for the men's room.
(over his shoulder) Fill it up.
You got it.
The rider's approach frightens the STAR MAN. He backs up the ladies' room door and knocks. There is no answer. He  tries the knob. With the other hand he inches the gun sli out of his pocket.
Jenny is bent over the sink dabbing nail polish around th corners of a paper towel. Her head snaps around to look a the doorknob. It holds.
Just a minute.
The STAR MAN tenses and forces a smile as the Rider passe in front of him. A VOICE comes from behind the faceplate.
Howdy... can't get her out.
(thru the smile) Gas.
I know how she feels.

The rider enters the men's room. As the door closes behin him, the STAR MAN's face falls and he knocks frantically the ladies' room door. Jenny opens it under his knuckles. blocks the doorway and she backs up as he steps inside.

The STAR MAN looks around. Jenny's eyes widen at what is  happening behind him. The pneumatic arm above the door is pulling it shut to reveal her paper towel pasted to the b The message on it, written in red lipstick, reads: KIDNAP GOING W ON 169 JADE MUS. LIC#PXV237.
(stepping around him) It's still a toilet. Hasn't become a  ballroom.
She tries to swing the door open and hide her message aga the wall, but she is too slow. The STAR MAN sees it and s forward to read.
Kid-nap-ped... go-ing W o-n...
Jenny realizes he doesn't know what it means.
(on her way out) That's very good.
Other graffiti on the door helps convince the STAR MAN Je message has nothing to do with him and after a last look it, he follows her.

A CAN of Coke CLATTERS DOWN the chute of a drink dispense Jenny picks it up and, with the STAR MAN hovering at her  shoulder, moves on to the candy machine. He watches a qua disappear into the slot and when Jenny picks another one of her purse, he points to it.
Money.
Yes.
She inserts the quarter and makes her selection. A Reese' Peanut Butter Cup drops from its position into the pickup bin.
What?
Candy.
Using the change from this and another quarter, she selec an Almond Joy.
(as it tumbles into  the bin) Money... candy.
(to the STAR MAN) That'll be fifteen fifty, sir.
Here.
She hands him a twenty.
Thank you.
He goes to make change.
(to himself) Thank you.
Jenny pops the top on the Coke can and on the way to the takes a sip.
What is... (reads off the can) ...Coke?
A drink.
(holds his hand out  for it) I...
You want to try it?
I want to try it.
This stuff could kill... (changes her mind and  smiles) Be my guest.
The STAR MAN fills his mouth, swirls it around and swallo
(after a loud burp) Good.
He hands the can back to Jenny. She looks at it and knows there are alien bacteria there her body would not like to meet.
Eh... you keep it. I've had enough.

The STAR MAN takes another drink. He stops dead when he l the can. Jenny continues for a few steps before she reali he isn't with her. She looks back over her shoulder. Her  eyes go immediately to where he is looking. The license p PXV 237 hangs like an accusation on the front bumper of t Mustang. Jenny decides to brazen it out.
What's the matter?
(throws the can to  the ground) Shit!
Jenny and the STAR MAN ride along in tight-lipped silence
What is kidnapped?
Jenny ignores him.
(yells) Kidnapped!!!
She flinches but remains silent. The STAR MAN snatches th paper towel off his lap and flaps it in her face, jabbing the word violently with a forefinger.
Kidnapped!!! What is kidnapped?!!
Jenny can't take it anymore and screams back at him throu tears.

Kidnapped is what you're doing to me  now!!! Kidnapped is pointing a gun  at me and taking me from my house!  Kidnapped is changing yourself into  my husband. I don't know what you  are and I don't care. I just want to  get away from you!
Jenny's outburst rocks the STAR MAN back into silence. He waits for her to calm down, then slowly takes the gun out his pocket.
Jennyhaydn.
She doesn't dare look at him.
I am good. (and he slides the  .45 under his seat)
Jenny speeds up to pass a truckload of horses.
What is that?
She doesn't answer. The car passes the truck. The highway before them is empty.
(finally) Horses.
(without looking at  her) Horses.
Jenny TURNS ON the RADIO and finds a COUNTRY AND WESTERN  STATION.
What?
Music.

It is pleasing to him and he listens for a while, then re in his pouch and takes out one of the dusty gray marbles. rolls it between his palms. It changes to a glowing gold it grows to the size of a baseball.
(alarmed) What are you doing?!
The STAR MAN brings the globe close to his mouth and spea into it.

(subtitles) Iron channel message. Transmute was  successful. Have captured one of  them. It is taking me to the pick-up  point in a land vehicle. (eyeing Jenny) I think I can control it by mastering  its language, which is primitive and  easy to learn. Will arrive on time.  Wait for me.
The STAR MAN opens his hands and, to Jenny's astonishment the ball rises quickly and seeps through her roof without leaving a trace.
The Mustang swerves violently, then straightens itself as the ball comes through the roof and surges into the sky.
Unexpectedly, Shermin's helicopter storms into view. It i so close we can count the rivets. As it clears, we go to:

The flow of traffic on the Interstate below is being fed  into the six television screens from infrared cameras on belly of the craft. The image on the screen under the mas begins to move and ends in a close-up of a green Mustang. It's not Jenny's. With a buzz the red dot appears and Fox face interrupts the view of the Mustang.

I just came from a meeting with the  Security Council and (the picture breaks  up, but the voice  continues) in view of the extraterrestrial's  radical change and the fact that all  our efforts (the picture re- assembles) to contact its ship remain unanswered,  it was decided to issue a ten state  'all points bulletin' for Scott Haydn,  Jenny Haydn and the green Mustang.  The officers have been instructed  not to approach the people or the  vehicle but to contact you. You will  then move in and contain the subjects.
Shermin rubs his hands over his face while he digests thi
(sorting it out) You sure you want this, because...  that's putting an awful lot of faith  in people we have no control over...
I'm afraid the situation demands  that kind of risk.
I don't like it, George...
Dammit Shermin. Earlier you were  asking for help. What's changed?
It's messy... the thing's got a gun...  We're just asking for somebody to  get killed...
We don't know what else to do. We  need results.
(accepting) You'll get results one way or the  other, that's for sure... Okay.
I'm gonna be here if you need  anything.
His image is replaced by one of the highway.
They're gonna let some local cop  blow him away.
Save us all a lot of trouble.
Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.
Bullshit!
You have no conception of this, do  you?

You jerk! You look at all the  sweetness and light and goodness you  think'll come out of this. You know  what's gonna come out of this... The  end of religion, the end of  civilization, the end of the earth.  We could become slaves, we could  become a colony of these things.  Don't you see that? Are you too stupid  to see that?
Are you ladies through?...
Bell and Lyman look at their feet.
Good... It looks like we might be  the welcoming committee, so I think  we should try and figure out what  we're gonna do if we have to come  face to face with this creature.
Bell wants us to get down on our  knees and bow.
(to Bell) Did your people have any contingencies  rehearsed?
No... I guess we never thought it  would happen.
It's Shermin's turn to look at his feet.
Terrific.
On one of the screens behind him the camera has picked up lighted billboard advertising 'Kellogg's Corn Flakes' wit its slogan 'HAVE A GREAT DAY.'
Jenny's Mustang is barreling along well over the speed li As it PASSES US, we PAN WITH it TO a sign: SLOW FOR  INTERSECTION.
A truckload of corn is hurtling down ON US from the north An empty semi is rumbling up from the south. The light is their favor.
The STAR MAN is driving. It is obvious that he doesn't se the red light facing him. But Jenny does. And she also se the trucks closing in from either side.
(loud) Red light!
The STAR MAN doesn't see it, doesn't believe her, doesn't slow down.
(screams) Stop!!!
It is as if all three vehicles have heard Jenny. They sla on their brakes at the same time and begin to skid toward each other. It's going to be close.
The prows of the trucks loom over Jenny and the STAR MAN  and, for a fleeting instant, it looks like they will join the bugs imbedded in the radiators.
The Mustang barely squeaks through and the trucks slam in each other behind it, spilling corn all over the highway.
It finally comes to a stop on the center line.
That was a red light!! I told you  you have to stop at a red light!!
(sheepish) It was yellow.
You didn't even see it.
The STAR MAN looks back for the traffic light. It is hang from a pole in the middle of the road. Under it the truck DRIVERS are climbing out of the cabs.
I will see it next time.
You better.
The STAR MAN angles back into his lane and begins to pick speed.
Deftly, the STAR MAN moves in and out of the afternoon  traffic. A bus coming in the other direction hits a potho filled with water and the SPLASH covers the Mustang.

Jenny watches the STAR MAN calmly turn on the wipers and washer and clean the windshield. The light above the  intersection ahead turns red and, even though he is still fiddling with the wipers, the STAR MAN manages a smooth s back of the crosswalk.
(indicating the red  dot on the satel  compass) Why are you going here? What is here?
My... (searches for word) ...car will take me... (pokes finger toward  sky) ...up there... home.
The light changes and the STAR MAN continues down the str
(at the red dot again) When do you have to be here?
I do not understand.
(rubs her temples and  laments to herself) How will I do this one?...
The answer is hovering above the city in front of them.
(pointing to the sun) Sun...
Yes.
Sun... day. No sun... night. You  understand?
Yes. Day... night.
How many days and nights do you have  to go... (prods the red dot) ...here?
Three nights... two days.
That's not much time. I'll just slow  you down. I have to sleep. I'm very  tired. And I have to wash and eat.  You don't...
I need you.
I won't tell anybody if that's what  you're worried about. I promise.  You'll keep...
No.
You'll keep the car. I'll take a  bus... (an awful possibility  occurs to her) Am I going up there with you... in  your ship... up there?
No.
Then let me go. You don't need me.
No.
I feel like I'm going crazy here.  You're Scott. But he's dead. I don't  know what's real anymore. I can't be  here with you.
The STAR MAN is unyielding.
Do you understand what I'm saying to  you? You can keep the car. (she hands him some  money) That should be enough for gas from  here to there. Please let me go.
(taps the red dot on  the satel compass) When we get here.
Jenny slams herself angrily back in the seat.
You bastard.

Her upper lip trembles and, in spite of herself, she migh cry. The STAR MAN sees the center lane is open. He checks his side mirror and drifts over, only to be caught by a l The car is still rolling when Jenny makes her move. She t open the door and, by the time the STAR MAN turns around, she is out and running.
Jennyhaydn!

He takes his foot off the brake to go after her and the c lurches into the cross traffic. He clambers back behind t wheel, regains control and cuts a hard right in front of other car waiting at the light.

Over her shoulder, Jenny can see the Mustang coming. She  dodges up a brick walkway toward a J.C. Penney shopping m The Mustang skids to a stop at the curb. The STAR MAN jum out in time to see Jenny push her way past a stream of  pedestrian traffic and enter the mall. He leaves the car zigzags through the people in that direction.
As he barges in, the STAR MAN accidentally knocks a cup o Coke out of a YOUNG MAN's hand.
Hey!!
In a panic to find Jenny, he continues jostling past peop to look in the shops that border the atrium.
Jenny warily approaches the railing and peers over. Below her the STAR MAN comes out of a record store. She turns a and gets on the escalator to the second floor.

The STAR MAN thinks he sees Jenny in an electronics store but when the girl turns around, it is obviously not her.  Backing out of there, he knocks over a sandwich board  advertising a restaurant. The LOUD THWACK it makes when i hits the cement turns faces in his direction. Jenny's is not among them. His eyes raise to the mezzanin Maybe she's there. He looks wildly around for a way up. H spots the escalator and, trying to keep the upper floor i view while he runs for it, he slams into an unattended pr It begins to tip over. The BABY INSIDE SCREAMS. The STAR manages to snatch it out of the carriage before it hits t floor. He is looking for a place to put it when the MOTHE comes charging out of a plant store.
My baby!!! He's stealing my baby!  Burt!!
The STAR MAN holds the baby out to her. She grabs it out of his hands and he turns to leave.
Burt!! Somebody stop him!! He was  stealing my baby!!
Two tough-looking MEN in T-shirts step in to block the ST MAN's way to the escalator.
Where you think you're going?
Not understanding, the STAR MAN tries to get by them. The push him back.
Please.
A tall, skinny blond man with spectacles elbows his way t the Mother.
He was trying to steal Gloria.
Two steps and Burt is on the STAR MAN. He spins him aroun
Is that right? Huh?
He throws him back against the crowd that has gathered.
(stutters) Please.
Burt pulls the STAR MAN up by his shirt front and shakes  him.
Is that right? Come on. Answer me.
Fear erases the STAR MAN's tenuous grasp of English and h begins to jabber in his own language. This makes Burt eve madder.
Were you trying to steal my baby?  Huh? Answer me!
Jennyhaydn!

Jenny has just gotten on the escalator to the third floor when she hears her name. She knows she shouldn't but she  gets off and joins the crowd at the railing. From there, can see the STAR MAN trapped in a circle of people. He cl Burt away from him and tries to thrash his way out of the mob.
Jennyhaydn!
One of the T-shirts throws him back and Burt begins to pu him. We MOVE IN UNTIL we are CLOSE ON Jenny's face.

Some of the onlookers have joined Burt in his attempt to  bring the STAR MAN down. Growling in his own language, th STAR MAN fights back as best he can. The sleeve of his  windbreaker is torn. One of the T-shirts lands a blow on right shoulder that turns the STAR MAN around. He takes a blow on the chest. Another in the kidneys. Burt gets a gr on the STAR MAN's left wrist and holds on. Stop it!!! Stop it!!!
She barges into the fray and starts peeling the men away  from the STAR MAN.

The men do. Jenny pushes the sleeve of the torn wind-brea back up on the STAR MAN's shoulder.

You're wrong!! He would never do  anything like that!! (takes STAR MAN's  hand) Let's go...
He had Gloria in his hands!
He's retarded! I shouldn't have left  him alone!
She starts to push out of the circle. Burt steps in to bl her.
(hisses) Get out of my way.
She stares at him until he does, then leads the STAR MAN  down the path that opens for them in the crowd. They pass MALL GUARD who has just arrived.

Still shaken, the STAR MAN nods. Jenny realizes that it i comforting to him to have his hand in hers and she leads like a child down the sidewalk to the Mustang.
(as Jenny puts him in  the passenger seat) Thank you.
The Mall Guard follows them down the walk-way and watches them drive off. He scribbles the license number in his  notebook.
At the counter Jenny puts her Visa card back into her wal while the CLERK staples the pages of a ticket into a trav folder.
(handing it to her) Gate three. It's boarding now.
Thank you.
Have a nice trip.

We FOLLOW Jenny THROUGH the people milling around the ben in the waiting area TO the STAR MAN seated in an open-fac coffee shop. He is watching a MOTHER feed her baby in the booth across from him. A map of the United States is spre out on the formica. Jenny plunks herself down catty-corne from him. The tear in his sleeve has been closed with saf pins.
The closest I was able to get you  was Lathrop Wells...
(pointing to baby) Is that a baby?
Yes.
A baby is a new person?
Eh... yes...

No... The closest...

Why?
I can't... Forget the baby. Okay?  The closest I was able to get you  was Lathrop Wells. You'll have to  hitchhike the rest of the way.
The STAR MAN looks at the map. Lathrop Wells is a small t north of Las Vegas on Highway 95. From there he runs his  finger to a spot in the Funeral Range of Death Valley.
But I must go here.

That's easy. I'll explain that in a  minute. This is your ticket. When  you get on the bus here, the driver  will take this part. You will ride  to Omaha. When you get to Omaha, ask  the driver. 'Salt Lake City, please.  I do not speak English.'
The STAR MAN nods that he understands.
Say it.
'Salt Lake City, please. I do not  speak English.'
The driver will...
